name: Intro to Latinx Culture
description:
Introduction to histories and cultures of Latinx (Mexican American, Puerto
Rican, Salvadoran American, Ecuadorian American, etc.) populations of the US.
Multiple genres of cultural production and representation, with a focus on
cultural diversity and regional difference. Introduction to critical analysis
across multiple genres of cultural production (literature, visual culture,
media culture, etc.).
prereq: SPA 024 or SPA 024S or SPA 033; or Consent of Instructor.

name: Writing in History
description: Advanced instruction in writing in history.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Research Meth in Psych
description:
Introduction to experimental design, interviews, questionnaires, field and
observational methods, reliability, and statistical inference.
prereq: (PSC 001 or PSC 001Y); PSC 012Y, STA 013, or STA 100 strongly recommended.

name: Introduction to CDG
description:
Overview of campus resources for career exploration and professional
development. Intended for first-year students in the College of Agricultural &
Environmental Sciences.

name: Reading & Writing
description:
Development of skills required for success in college-level writing across
genres and disciplines. Integrates reading, critical thinking, and written
communication, using texts from across the curriculum.

name: Gender & Race Experience
description:
Exploration of the co-construction of “race” and gender in comparative
national historical contexts and contemporary lived experience. Study of
intersections of race and gender in identities and how institutions, labor
migration, social movements and consumption shape racialized gendered
identities.

name: Production Lab
description: Laboratory experience in quantity food production and service.

name: Soils in Our Environment
description:
Soils in our global ecosystem; soils as natural bodies formed by interactive
environmental processes; soil response to use and management; sustainable use
of soil resources; role of soils in agricultural and environmental issues;
role of soils in our daily lives.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Introduction to Spanish grammar and development of all language skills in a
cultural context with special emphasis on communication.

name: Jazz
description:
Jazz and the evolution of jazz styles in historical and cultural context. For
non-majors.
prereq:
MUS 003A or MUS 006A or MUS 010 or MUS 011 or MUS 028; or Consent of
Instructor.

name: Western Civ
description: Development of Western Civilization from the 18th century to the present.

name: Rules of Electoral Game
description:
Analysis of laws and court cases on the organization and administration of
elections in the United States. Topics include campaign finance,
redistricting, voting rights, race & representation, and comparisons with
other democracies.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and non-profit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Third World Dev
description:
Introduction to theories and contemporary issues in the sociology of
development. Topics such as urbanization, rural/agrarian change, class, status
groups, international division of labor, sectoral shifts, international
capital, informal economy, gender, and political processes are analyzed within
a comparative-historical framework.

name: Internship Community Hth
description:
The student, through fieldwork in a community health agency, learns to apply
theory and concepts learned in the classroom.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division and graduate students.

name: Plant Anatomy
description:
Structural anatomy of vascular plants. Training in basic tissue sectioning,
staining, and use of the compound microscope.
prereq: BIS 002C; Or other similar preparation in plant biology.

name: Writing in Engineering
description: Advanced instruction in writing in engineering.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Indust & Social Change
description:
Selected technological and social factors. Preconditions of economic
development and industrialization. Social, political, and cultural issues at
various levels of economic development. Major historical differences and major
current trends. Emphasis either on highly industrialized countries or on less
developed countries.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: ICA Sports Program
description:
Sport specific advanced comprehensive training, instruction, and practice for
the highly skilled collegiate varsity athlete. Development and improvement of
performance skills utilizing motor-learning, nutritional science, and
motivational theory. Classes offered in all UC Davis intercollegiate athletic
sports.

name: Intro Multiling Writing
description:
Reading and writing paragraphs and short multi-paragraph texts for academic
purposes. Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Plant Metab Process Lab
description:
Techniques and instruments used to study plant metabolic processes, including
water relations, respiration, photosynthesis, enzyme kinetics, microscopy,
immunochemistry, and nitrogen fixation. Quantitative methods, problem solving,
and practical applications are emphasized.
prereq: PLS 100A { can be concurrent }; Or the equivalent.

name: Intro Social Rsch
description:
Examination of the methodological problems of social research. Selection and
definition of problems of investigation, data-gathering techniques, and
sampling.

name: First-Year Seminar
description:
Investigation of a special topic through shared readings, discussions, written
assignments, term papers, and special activities (such as fieldwork, site
visits, laboratory work, etc.). Emphasis placed upon student participation in
learning. Students may take more than one First-Year Seminar, but may not take
more than one in any given quarter.

name: Music as Culture
description:
Introduction to the study of music in cross-cultural perspective. Basic
theories and frameworks of ethnomusicology; in-depth case studies of three
musical traditions from around the world. Intended for music majors.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Directed group study.

name: Social Policy
description:
Examination of social policies that affect the well-being of individuals,
families and groups, including such policies as old-age pensions, health
insurance, and aid to the poor.

name: Nonparametric Statistics
description:
Sign and Wilcoxon tests, Walsh averages. Two-sample procedures. Inferences
concerning scale. Kruskal-Wallis test. Measures of association. Chi square and
Kolmogorov-Smirnov tests.
prereq:
STA 013 C- or better or STA 013Y C- or better or STA 032 C- or better or STA
100 C- or better

name: Writers' Workshop
description:
Writing course focuses on the development of writing and revision strategies,
exploring ways to understand a writing task; to develop appropriate content
for a writing task; to revise content to reflect competence as a communicator.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Directed group study. May be taught abroad.

name: ICA Sports Program
description:
Sport specific advanced comprehensive training, instruction, and practice for
the highly skilled collegiate varsity athlete. Development and improvement of
performance skills utilizing motor-learning, nutritional science, and
motivational theory. Classes offered in all UC Davis intercollegiate athletic
sports.

name: Preparatory Chem-SCC110C
description: Not available.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Introduction to reading and composing processes and key rhetorical concepts
for academic literacies. Multiple drafts of composing projects in a variety of
genres and modes with feedback from peers and the instructor.
prereq: Completion of Entry Level Writing Requirement (ELWR).

name: Modern Spanish Theater
description:
Study of the main dramatic trends and playwrights of modern Spanish theater.
Selected works by Valle Inclán, García-Lorca, Mihura, Buero-Vallejo, Arrabal
and others. Offered in alternate years.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: Business Writing Hybrid
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and nonprofit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Int Social Research
description:
Data-analysis techniques, measurement, scaling, multivariate analysis, and
quantitative measures of association.

name: Style in the Essay
description:
Principles of style, language, and structure in the essay. Analysis and
development of voice and genre, including sentence revision for force and
clarity, and development of effective paragraphs and essays.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; or equivalent.

name: History of the Bible
description:
History of the formation of the Christian biblical canon, with emphasis on
differences between Christian traditions; survey of translations and
adaptations of biblical narrative in Christianity, Judaism, and Islam, as well
as in contemporary culture.

name: Fundamentalism
description:
Introduction to comparative religion, focusing on the idea of fundamentalism
in different religious traditions.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Introduction to reading and composing processes and key rhetorical concepts
for academic literacies. Multiple drafts of composing projects in a variety of
genres and modes with feedback from peers and the instructor.
prereq: Completion of Entry Level Writing Requirement (ELWR).

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Anly Categor Data
description:
Varieties of categorical data, cross-classifications, contingency tables,
tests for independence. Multidimensional tables and log-linear models, maximum
likelihood estimation; tests of goodness-of-fit. Logit models, linear logistic
models. Analysis of incomplete tables. Packaged computer programs, analysis of
real data.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Elementary Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; basic probability concepts; binomial, normal,
Student's t, and chi-square distributions. Hypothesis testing and confidence
intervals for one and two means and proportions. Regression.
prereq: Two years of high school algebra or Mathematics D.

name: First-Year Seminar
description:
Investigation of a special topic through shared readings, discussions, written
assignments, term papers, and special activities (such as fieldwork, site
visits, laboratory work, etc.). Emphasis placed upon student participation in
learning. Students may take more than one First-Year Seminar, but may not take
more than one in any given quarter.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and non-profit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: First Year Transfer
description:
Integration of transfer students into university life. Comprehensive
foundation for a successful career at UC Davis. Transition from community
college to the university, quarter vs. semester systems, academic expectations
of faculty and developing skills to meet them, overview of campus resources,
evaluating and applying information, social and professional development, and
academic planning.

name: ICA Sports Program
description:
Sport specific advanced comprehensive training, instruction, and practice for
the highly skilled collegiate varsity athlete. Development and improvement of
performance skills utilizing motor-learning, nutritional science, and
motivational theory. Classes offered in all UC Davis intercollegiate athletic
sports.

name: Intro Multiling Writing
description:
Reading and writing paragraphs and short multi-paragraph texts for academic
purposes. Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Algebra Review-SCC170M
description: Not available.

name: Data & Society
description:
Introduction to basic data science concepts, defining problems, clarifying
questions, identifying stakeholders, caring for and cleaning data,
interviewing techniques, structuring presentations, use of Excel for data
problems.

name: Internship in Writing
description:
Internships in fields where students can practice their skills. May be taught
abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 or UWP 001V or UWP 001Y or ENL 003; or equivalent course; consent of
instructor.

name: Analytical Mechanic
description:
Principles and applications of Newtonian mechanics; introduction to Lagrange’s
and Hamilton’s equations
prereq:
(PHY 009B C or better, PHY 009C C or better, PHY 009D C or better) or (PHY
009HB C or better, PHY 009HC C or better, PHY 009HD C or better, PHY 009HE C
or better); (MAT 021D C or better, (MAT 022A C or better or MAT 027A C or
better), (MAT 022B C or better or MAT 027B C or better)); or Consent of
Instructor.

name: Writing in Bio Sci
description: Advanced instruction in writing in biology.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Preparatory Chem-SCC110C
description: Not available.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and non-profit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description:
Angular momentum and spin; hydrogen atom and atomic spectra; perturbation
theory; scattering theory.
prereq: PHY 115A C- or better; Or consent of department.

name: City Life
description:
Critical dissection of the loss of community issue. Analysis of the
organization of primary ties in the city, of the culture of urban public life
and of the learning of city skills.

name: Principles Soil Sci
description:
Soil as part of natural and managed ecosystems and landscapes. Solid, liquid,
and gas phases and their interactions in the soil. Water, gas and heat
movement in soil. Soil biology. Plant nutrient acquisition and use.Soil
development, management and use.
prereq:
College-level courses in each of chemistry, physics, biology, and geology
recommended.

name: Regression Analysis
description:
Simple linear regression, variable selection techniques, stepwise regression,
analysis of covariance, influence measures, computing packages.
prereq:
STA 013 C- or better or STA 013Y C- or better or STA 032 C- or better or STA
100 C- or better

name: Applied Stat for Bio Sci
description:
Descriptive statistics, probability, sampling distributions, estimation,
hypothesis testing, contingency tables, ANOVA, regression; implementation of
statistical methods using computer package.
prereq: MAT 016B C- or better or MAT 017B C- or better or MAT 021B C- or better

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Introduction to Spanish grammar and development of all language skills in a
cultural context with special emphasis on communication.

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Research Meth in Psych
description:
Introduction to experimental design, interviews, questionnaires, field and
observational methods, reliability, and statistical inference.
prereq: (PSC 001 or PSC 001Y); PSC 012Y, STA 013, or STA 100 strongly recommended.

name: India Pop Religious Art
description:
Survey of Indian popular religious art in prints, trade labels, comics and
photographs.

name: College Writing-SCC157P
description: Not available.

name: Personality Psychology
description:
Scientific study of personality. Methods of personality research. Overview of
current research and theory in the field of personality psychology. May be
taught abroad.

name: Intro Gender Studies
description:
Introduction to interdisciplinary, critical gender studies. Addresses the
emergence of women’s, gender and feminist studies internationally, its links
to women’s movements, and its influence within the various arts, humanities
and social science disciplines.

name: Globalization & Health
description:
Provides an overview of the evidence on the multiple effects of globalization
policies on health.

name: Public Sector Policy
description:
Theoretical rationale for governmental activity, program evaluation, PPBS,
positive theories of policy making, the quantitative study of policy
determinants, implementation, and proposals for improved decision making.

name: Bot Physiol Cultiv Plant
description:
Holistic introduction to the underlying botanical and physiological principles
of cultivated plants and their response to the environment. Includes concepts
behind plant selection, cultivation, and utilization. Laboratories include
discussion and interactive demonstrations.
prereq: High school course in biology and chemistry recommended.

name: Viticultural Practices
description:
Identification, cultivation, and use of the major wine, table, raisin, and
rootstock cultivars. Includes practices specific to the fall such as fruit
contracts, maturity sampling, harvesting, cover crops, and soil-pests. One
field trip required.

name: Critical Fashion Studies
description:
Feminist cultural studies of style-fashion-dress through transnational
circuits, personal subjectivities. Fashion as means of gender oppression and
liberation. Histories and discourses of masculinities and femininities.
Clothing works on global assembly line. Use of dress in
construction/regulation of identities.

name: Electricty & Magnetsm
description:
Theory of electrostatics, electromagnetism, Maxwell's equations,
electromagnetic waves.
prereq: PHY 110B C- or better; Or consent of department.

name: Plant Ecology
description:
The study of the interactions between plants, plant populations or vegetation
types and their physical and biological environment. Special emphasis on
California. Four full-day field trips and brief write-up of class project
required.
prereq:
(BIS 001A, BIS 001B, BIS 001C) or (BIS 002A, BIS 002B, BIS 002C); PLB 111
recommended.

name: Reading & Writing
description:
Development of skills required for success in college-level writing across
genres and disciplines. Integrates reading, critical thinking, and written
communication, using texts from across the curriculum.

name: Global Humanities
description:
Introduction to humanities topics and methodologies; analysis of major
figures, works, and genres in world arts and literatures, with emphasis on
relationships between history, society, and culture.

name: International Migration
description:
Analysis of worldwide migration patterns, and social scientific theories of
international and transnational migration. Focus in economical, political, and
social impact of immigration and potential for international and regional
cooperation.
prereq: SOC 001, SOC 002, SOC 003, or SOC 004 recommended.

name: Multilingual Writing
description:
Development of multilingual writers' composition and English language skills
across genres and disciplines. Integrates college-level reading, critical
thinking, and written communication, using texts from across the curriculum.
prereq:
Enrollment via campus placement (using the English Language Placement Exam or
Analytical Writing Placement Exam) or after successful completion of UWP 022.

name: Preparatory Chem-SCC110C
description: Not available.

name: Internship Pub Aff
description:
Supervised internship and study in political, governmental, or related
organizations.
prereq:
Enrollment dependent on availability of intern positions with highest priority
assigned to students with Political Science Public Service major; upper
division standing.

name: Intro to Bio Psych
description:
Survey and integration of the relationships between behavior and biological
processes, including physiology, genes, development, ecology, and evolution.
May be taught abroad.

name: Infant Development
description:
Psychological development in infancy. Topics include physical and motor
development, sensory and nervous system development, and memory and cognitive
development. Emphasis will be on evaluating theories, empirical research, and
experimental methods for understanding infant development.

name: Intermediate Spanish I
description:
Continuation of SPA 003, SPA 003V, SPA 003Y, SPA 003S, or previous high school
experience in the areas of grammar and intermediate language skills. Online
format combining synchronous chatting with technologically based materials.
prereq:
SPA 003 or SPA 003Y or SPA 003V; Or the equivalent from previous high school
language experience.

name: Writing in Engineering
description: Advanced instruction in writing in engineering.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Applied Linguistics
description:
Applications of linguistic principles and the analysis of language-related
issues in the world. Exploration of a range of language-related problems
including issues related to language learning and teaching to issues
concerning language and gender, race, class and the media.

name: Environmental Sociology
description:
Production, consumption, and urban expansion. Basic social logics surrounding
current problems of resource scarcity (environmental extractions) and excess
wastes (environmental additions). Ways that society can change and re-organize
itself to become more environmentally conscious and hence ecologically
sustainable.

name: History Of The U S
description:
The experience of the American people from the Civil War to the end of the
Cold War.

name: Business Writing Hybrid
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and nonprofit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Self & Society
description:
Exploration of how self and identity are formed and transformed by
socialization and social interaction in relation to roles, groups,
institutions, power, and social change. Consideration of how people make
decisions, fall in love, and come to blows.

name: Study Community Intl Hth
description:
Study and experience for undergraduate students in any number of areas in
community and international health.

name: Popular Culture
description:
Social mechanisms that shape modern popular culture. High, folk, and mass
culture: historical emergence of popular culture. Mass media,
commercialization, ideology and cultural styles. Theories and methods for
analyzing cultural expressions in pop music, street art, film, television, and
advertising.
